metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12526 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.9. URN response handling in Squid suffers from a heap-based buffer overflow. When receiving data from a remote server in response to an URN request, Squid fails to ensure that the response can fit within the buffer. This leads to attacker controlled data overflowing in the heap.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.4').
